gadget.title: Motorola Xoom
gadget.description: Powered by a dual-core processor and Android 3.0 (Honeycomb), its 10.1-inch display is perfect for all media - including Adobe Flash.

gadget.title: Sony PlayStation3
gadget.description: The PlayStation3 system gives you more of what you want -More memory, better quality visuals, tons of games

gadget.title: Motorola Atrix 4G
gadget.description: The new MOTOROLA ATRIX 4G is a dual-core smartphone with online computer power.

gadget.title: Alienware M15x
gadget.description: Take control of the game once and for all with the Alienware M15x, the universe's most powerful 15 inch gaming laptop.

gadget.title: Razer Ferox
gadget.description: The Razer Ferox is a portable, mini stereo speaker set that holds true to the saying.

gadget.title: Razer Megalodon
gadget.description: Utilizing next generation HRTF technologies & a superb DSP, the Razer Megalodon is the most advanced audio headset of its kind.

gadget.title: Canon Rebel T2i
gadget.description: Canon's Rebel T2i is an incredible camera. It takes fantastic photos and video for the price. It's a camera you can grow with.

gadget.title: Razer Deathadder
gadget.description: The Razer DeathAdder is the weapon of choice for gamers seeking a combination of comfort and unbridled gaming precision.

gadget.title: Samsung Galaxy S2
gadget.description: With its dual-core CPU, the Samsung Galaxy S II is every inch the 'super-phone'. Possibly, best Android phone ever made till date?

gadget.title: LG Optimus One
gadget.description: It offers a super combination of price and performance which makes it great value for money. Gingerbread update arriving soon.

gadget.title: HTC Desire HD
gadget.description: The Desire HD has every feature you could ever want, performance as fast as you'll ever need, effortless usability.

gadget.title: Razer Orca
gadget.description: Whether you are taunting your gaming opponent or just tuning into music, Razer Orca provides comfort while keeping your sound precise.

gadget.title: Razer Switchblade
gadget.description: Gaming Netbook of the future, or bizarre concept device? Check out the Razer Switchblade and decide for yourself.
